body_html:
From the error message, it seems that you're trying to restore a checkpoint that doesn't contain weights for one of your models.

The error stacktrace provided seems to be truncated (instead of the full error seen) and the code provided isn't sufficient to reproduce the problem (e.g., I have no clue what the FD2 module is or how the checkpoints were created).

I'd suggest trying to distill the code above into a small reproducible example.

In general, if you combine two networks into one graph, then you'd want to checkpoint the combined graph. Alternatively, you could use separate graphs and sessions for each network.

body:
From the error message, it seems that you're trying to restore a checkpoint that doesn't contain weights for one of your models.

The error stacktrace provided seems to be truncated (instead of the full error seen) and the code provided isn't sufficient to reproduce the problem (e.g., I have no clue what the `FD2` module is or how the checkpoints were created).

I'd suggest trying to distill the code above into a small reproducible example.

In general, if you combine two networks into one graph, then you'd want to checkpoint the combined graph. Alternatively, you could use separate graphs and sessions for each network.
